attributes.comment:
I vigorously oppose the proposed increase in fees charged for foreign
adoptions. These fees are already high enough to discourage some families from
adopting a child from another country, at a time when there are more children
desperately needing adoption. Part of the rationale for the increase is to
cover the cost of processing requests for asylum. The government of the United
States of America should not ask families seeking to adopt children to foot the
cost of a normal, expected cost of government. Many of these families are
borrowing money, asking friends and family to help cover the cost of the
adoption, taking on extra jobs,and reducing their savings to fund the adoption.
Not every family has the resources of Madonna or Angelina Jolie.

The proposed consolidation of the various fees into one fee is a great idea.
That streamlining of the process should save nearly enough money to obviate the
need for the proposed increases. It will certainly make the process easier for
families seeking to adopt a foreign national child.

Why would an administration committed to preserving and supporting families put
this additional obstacle in the way of people trying to extend American
compassion and aid beyond our borders?

This proposed increase in fees for foreign adoptions should be withdrawn after
full public comment. The proposed streamlining of the process should be adopted.

Thank you for considering my comments.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Mark Ellis
